US Highway 97 runs through the center of town.
The town is small enough to walk around in, but you may want a car since the only sidewalks are in the downtown area, and the upcoming resort cottages are spread out across Lake Osoyoos.
Most stores in Oroville, other than Princes, close at 5PM.

value: Princes market, a supermarket and general store.
Beemans, a smaller (slightly less expensive) supermarket.
Numerous antique stores and gas stations.

Most restaurants in Oroville will be closed periodically during the winter, and at least once or twice a week thereafter.  Most restaurants in Oroville close by 9PM.

value: , a casual family-orientated Mexican restaurant.  Includes giant margaritas as well as beer.

, fine dining in a casual atmosphere.  Family friendly with pool tables and televisions for all ages as well as summer patio dining.  A wide variety of menu items to suit all tastes and budgets now featuring Chicago-Style Deep Dish Pizza, large enough for the whole family.
, a small diner known for hamburgers.
, a small cafe of baked goods and sandwiches serving breakfast and lunch.

content=Globe At The Beach is a contemporary beach side restaurant at Veranda Beach Resort, offering breakfast, lunch and dinner. Fine dining quality with outstanding local ingredients in a beautiful and relaxed casual setting. From a simple milkshake treat thru to full 3 course celebration dinner, Globe will excite your tastebuds for sure ....
address=299 East Lake Road, Oroville, WA
price=Starts at $179 a night for a private cottage

content=Veranda Beach Resort is an 800 acre family beach resort on the shores of Lake Osoyoos, with over a mile of pristine beach. Stay in private 2, 3 or 4 bedroom cottages. Pet friendly accommodation also available.
